s2.ptxt: Apply adhesive around the tight plugs.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Adhesive 1324, Three Bond 1324 or Equivalent

s2.ptxt: Using SST and a hammer, tap in new tight plugs as shown in the illustration.
Using an E8 "TORX" socket wrench, install the stud bolts labeled A.
Using an E7 "TORX" socket wrench, install the stud bolt labeled B.

atten4.ptxt: When reusing the stud bolt, apply adhesive to the bolt before installing it.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Adhesive 1344, Three Bond 1344 or equivalent

s2.ptxt: Using an E7 "TORX" socket wrench, install the stud bolts labeled C.
Using a plastic-faced hammer, tap in new straight pins to the cylinder block.
Using a plastic-faced hammer, tap in new ring pins to the cylinder block.
Using a 5 mm hexagon wrench, install the oil nozzle.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL CYLINDER BLOCK WATER DRAIN COCK

s2.ptxt: Install the cylinder block water drain cock as shown in the illustration.
Assemble the piston and connecting rod.

s3.ptxt: Using a small screwdriver, install a new snap ring at one end of the piston pin hole.
Gradually heat the piston to approximately 80 to 90°C (176 to 194°F).
Coat the piston pin with engine oil.
Align the front marks of the piston and connecting rod, and push in the piston pin with your thumb.

atten4.ptxt: The piston and pin are a matched set.

s3.ptxt: Check the fit between the piston and piston pin by trying to move the piston back and forth on the piston pin.
Using a small screwdriver, install a new snap ring at the other end of the piston pin hole.

s2.ptxt: Install the piston rings.

s3.ptxt: Install the oil ring expander and 2 side rails by hand.
Using a piston ring expander, install the 2 compression rings with the painted mark as shown in the illustration.

item.ptxt: The No. 1 compression ring is reversible.
There are 2 types of No. 1 compression rings. One type has a code mark and the other does not.
Install the No. 1 compression ring with the code mark (1N) facing upward.
Install the No. 2 compression ring with the code mark (2N) facing upward.

s2.ptxt: Position the piston rings so that the ring ends are as shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Do not align the ring ends.

s2.ptxt: Align the bearing claw with the groove of the connecting rod or connecting cap.
Install the bearings in the connecting rod and connecting rod cap.

atten3.ptxt: Clean the backside of the bearing and the bearing surface of the connecting rod. The surface should be free of dust and oil.

item.ptxt: Do not apply engine oil to the bearing's contact area and backside.
The crankshaft bearing cap bolt is tightened in 2 progressive steps.

s2.ptxt: Clean the main journal, and the interior and exterior of the bearing.
Install the upper bearing.

s3.ptxt: Install the upper bearing to the cylinder block so that the upper bearing's lubrication hole is centered within the cylinder block's lubrication hole, as shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Do not apply engine oil to the bearing's contact area and backside.

s2.ptxt: Install the lower bearing.

s3.ptxt: Install the lower bearing to the bearing cap.
Using a vernier caliper, measure the distance between the bearing cap's edge and the lower bearing's edge.

atten3.ptxt: Do not apply engine oil to the bearing's contact area and backside.

s2.ptxt: With the upper bearing and lower bearing installed, use a plastic-faced hammer to install the bearing caps to the cylinder block.

atten3.ptxt: Make sure the bearing cap's front mark and journal number are correct.

s2.ptxt: Using a vernier caliper, measure the amount of misalignment between the upper bearing and lower bearing, as shown in the illustration.
Remove the bearing cap.
Install the crankshaft thrust washer upper to the cylinder block.

s3.ptxt: Install the 2 thrust washers under the No. 3 journal position of the cylinder block with the oil grooves facing outward.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful when installing the thrust bearing upper and lower as they are similar but cannot be interchanged.

s2.ptxt: Install the 2 thrust washers on the No. 3 bearing cap with the grooves facing outward.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful when installing the thrust bearing upper and lower as they are similar but cannot be interchanged. The lower bearing has a claw as shown in the illustration.

s2.ptxt: Apply engine oil to the upper bearing, then place the crankshaft on the cylinder block.
Apply engine oil to the lower bearing.
Install the 5 crankshaft bearing caps in their proper locations.
Install the crankshaft bearing cap bolts.

item.ptxt: The main bearing cap bolts are tightened in 2 progressive steps.
If any of the main bearing cap bolts are broken or deformed, replace them as necessary.

s3.ptxt: Install and uniformly tighten the 10 main bearing cap bolts in the sequence shown in the illustration.
If any one of the main bearing cap bolts does not meet the torque specification, replace the main bearing cap bolt.
Mark the front of the bearing cap bolts with paint.
Retighten the bearing cap bolts by 90° in the numerical order above.
Check that the painted marks are now at a 90° angle to the front.

s2.ptxt: Check that the crankshaft turns smoothly.
Check the crankshaft thrust clearance.
Using a piston ring compressor, push the correctly numbered piston and connecting rod assembly into the cylinder with the front mark of the piston facing forward.

s3.ptxt: Match the numbered connecting rod cap with the connecting rod.
Align the pins of the connecting rod cap with the pin holes of the connecting rod, and install the connecting rod cap.
Check that the front mark of the connecting rod cap is facing forward.

s2.ptxt: Install the connecting rod cap bolts.

item.ptxt: The connecting rod cap bolts are tightened in 2 progressive steps.
If any connecting rod bolt is broken or deformed, replace it.

s3.ptxt: Apply a light coat of engine oil on the threads and under the heads of the connecting rod cap bolts.
Install and alternately tighten the bolts of the connecting rod cap in several passes.
If any one of the connecting rod cap bolts does not meet the torque specification, replace the cap bolts.
Mark the front of the connecting rod cap bolts with paint.
Retighten the connecting rod cap bolts by 90° as shown.
Check that the painted marks are now at a 90° angle to the front.

s2.ptxt: Check that the crankshaft turns smoothly.
Check the connecting rod thrust clearance.
Using a plastic-faced hammer, tap in a new ring pin until the pin stops.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL NO. 1 HEAD STRAIGHT SCREW PLUG

s2.ptxt: Using a 10 mm hexagon wrench, install a new gasket and the straight screw plug.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL NO. 2 HEAD STRAIGHT SCREW PLUG

s2.ptxt: Using a 19 mm hexagon wrench, install a new gasket and the straight screw plug.
Apply adhesive to the tight plug hole of the cylinder head.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Adhesive 1324, Three Bond 1324 or Equivalent

s2.ptxt: Using SST, tap in a new tight plug to the cylinder head as shown in the illustration.
Using E5 and E7 "TORX" socket wrenches, install the stud bolts.

torqueitem.ptxt: for stud bolt B and C

s2.ptxt: Check that no foreign matter is on the mesh part of the filter.
If foreign objects are present, clean the part thoroughly.
Using a 6 mm hexagon wrench, install a new gasket and the oil control valve filter with the screw plug.
Apply a light coat of engine oil on a new oil seal.

atten3.ptxt: Pay close attention when installing the intake and exhaust oil seals. For example, installing the intake oil seal into the exhaust or installing the exhaust oil seal to the intake can cause installation problems later.

atten4.ptxt: The intake valve oil seal is gray and the exhaust valve oil seal is black.

s2.ptxt: Using SST, push in the oil seal.

atten3.ptxt: Failure to use SST will cause the seal to be damaged or improperly seated.

s2.ptxt: Apply plenty of engine oil to the tip area of the intake valve indicated in the illustration.
Install the valve, spring seat, compression spring and spring retainer to the cylinder head.

atten3.ptxt: Install the same parts in the same combination to the original locations.

s2.ptxt: Using SST and wooden blocks, compress the spring and install the 2 retainer locks.
Using a 5 mm pin punch and plastic-faced hammer, lightly tap the valve stem tip to ensure a proper fit.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the valve stem tip.

s2.ptxt: Apply plenty of engine oil to the tip area of the intake valve indicated in the illustration.
Install the valve, spring seat, compression spring and spring retainer to the cylinder head.

atten3.ptxt: Install the same parts in the same combination to the original locations.

s2.ptxt: Using SST and wooden blocks, compress the spring and install the 2 retainer locks.
Using a 5 mm pin punch and plastic-faced hammer, lightly tap the valve stem tip to ensure a proper fit.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the valve stem tip.

item.ptxt: Keep the lash adjuster free from dirt and foreign objects.
Only use clean engine oil.

s2.ptxt: Place the lash adjuster into a container full of engine oil.
Insert SST's tip into the lash adjuster's plunger and use the tip to press down on the check ball inside the plunger.
Squeeze SST and the lash adjuster together to move the plunger up and down 5 to 6 times.
Check the movement of the plunger and bleed the air.

atten3.ptxt: When bleeding high-pressure air from the compression chamber, make sure that the tip of SST is actually pressing the check ball as shown in the illustration. If the check ball is not pressed, air will not bleed.

s2.ptxt: After bleeding the air, remove SST. Then, try to quickly and firmly press the plunger with one finger.

specitem.ptxt: Plunger is very difficult to move.

s2.ptxt: If the result is not as specified, replace the lash adjuster.

atten3.ptxt: Install the lash adjuster to the same place it was removed from.

s2.ptxt: Apply a light coat of engine oil to the valve stem cap.
Install the valve stem cap to the cylinder head.
Apply clean engine oil to the valve lash adjuster tip and valve stem cap surface. Then install the valve rocker arm.

atten3.ptxt: Install the valve stem cap, lash adjuster and valve rocker arm to the same place it was removed from.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL ENGINE REAR OIL SEAL RETAINER

s2.ptxt: Apply seal packing in a continuous line to the places shown in the illustration.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Adhesive 1344, Three Bond 1344 or Equivalent

item.ptxt: Remove any oil from the contact surface.
Install the crankcase within 3 minutes after applying seal packing.
Do not start the engine for at least 2 hours after the installation.

s2.ptxt: Install the oil seal with the 6 bolts.
Install a new O-ring to the oil filter bracket.
Install a new O-ring and gasket to the oil filter bracket union bolt.

atten3.ptxt: Apply a light coat of engine oil to the new O-ring.

s2.ptxt: Install the oil filter bracket with the oil filter union bolt and nut.
Using a 27 mm socket wrench, install the oil filter union.
Check and clean the oil filter installation surface.
Apply clean engine oil to the gasket of a new oil filter.
Lightly screw the oil filter into place, and tighten it until the gasket contacts the seat.
Using SST, tighten the oil filter.

s3.ptxt: When using a torque wrench:
When not using a torque wrench:
Tighten the oil filter a 3/4 turn using a common wrench.

s2.ptxt: Apply seal packing to the cylinder block upper side and cylinder head gasket upper side as shown in the illustration.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Seal Packing 1282B, Three Bond 1282B or Equivalent

item.ptxt: Remove any oil from the contact surface.
Install the cylinder head gasket within 3 minutes after applying the seal packing.
Install the cylinder head bolts within 15 minutes after applying the seal packing.
Do not add engine oil within 4 hours of installation.

s2.ptxt: Place a new cylinder head gasket on the cylinder block surface with the Lot No. stamp facing upward.

item.ptxt: Make sure the installation direction is correct.
Place the cylinder head gently to avoid damaging the gasket with the bottom part of the head.

atten4.ptxt: The cylinder head bolts are tightened in 3 progressive steps.

s2.ptxt: Place the cylinder head on the cylinder block.
Apply a light coat of engine oil on the threads and under the heads of the cylinder head bolts.
Using a 10 mm bi-hexagon wrench, install and uniformly tighten the 10 cylinder head bolts with the plate washers, in several passes, in the sequence shown.
Mark the front of the cylinder head bolt heads with paint.
Retighten the cylinder head bolts by 90° in the numerical order shown.
Retighten the cylinder head bolts by an additional 90°.
Check that the painted marks are now facing rearward.
Seal packing will seep out on the engine's front side. Thoroughly wipe clean any seal packing.
Put the camshaft timing gear and camshaft together by aligning the key groove and straight pin.
Check that there is no gap between the gear's flange and the camshaft.
With the camshaft timing gear fixed in place, tighten the flange bolt.
Clamp the camshaft in a vise and then install the camshaft timing sprocket to the camshaft with the sprocket bolt.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the camshaft in the vise.

s2.ptxt: Apply clean engine oil to the camshaft's cam portion and the cylinder head journals.
Set the camshaft and No. 2 camshaft as shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Before and after setting the camshaft and No. 2 camshaft, firmly set the rocker arm to the lash adjuster.

s2.ptxt: Loosely install the No. 1 camshaft bearing cap.
Check the proper location of each No. 2 camshaft bearing cap and install each one.
Install a new O-ring to the No. 1 camshaft bearing cap.
Loosely install the oil delivery pipe.
Tighten the 21 bolts in the order shown in the illustration.
Install a new gasket and the oil jet with the bolt.
Install the 2 pulley keys to the crankshaft.
Install the sensor plate with the front mark facing forward.
Install the timing sprocket as shown in the illustration.
Install the vibration damper with the 2 bolts.
As shown in the illustration, install the chain on the sprocket and gear with the painted marks aligned with the timing marks on the sprocket and gear.

item.ptxt: The camshaft mark plate is yellow.
The crankshaft mark plate is orange.

s2.ptxt: Use a rope to tie the chain of the crankshaft timing sprocket. Tie the rope near the sprocket.

atten3.ptxt: After the chain tensioner has been installed, the rope must be removed.

atten4.ptxt: The rope is tied so that the chain will not jump a tooth.

s2.ptxt: Install the tensioner slipper with the bolt.
Move the stopper plate upward to release the lock, and push the plunger deep into the tensioner.
Move the stopper plate downward to set the lock, and insert a 12.7 mm hexagon wrench into the stopper plate's hole.
Install a new gasket and the chain tensioner with the bolt and nut.
Install a new O-ring and the chain guide with the 2 bolts.
Remove the hexagon wrench.
Coat the relief valve with engine oil.
Insert the relief valve and spring into the pump body hole.
Install a new gasket to the plug.
Using a 27 mm socket wrench, install the plug.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL TIMING CHAIN COVER OIL SEAL

s2.ptxt: Place the timing chain cover on wooden blocks.
Using a screwdriver with its tip taped, pry out the oil seal.
Using SST and a hammer, tap in a new oil seal until its surface is flush with the timing chain cover edge.

item.ptxt: Keep the lip free from foreign matter.
Do not tap the oil seal at an angle.

atten4.ptxt: When installing the crankshaft pulley, check the shape of the pulley. The correct pulley has a groove (See page ).

s2.ptxt: Apply a light coat of MP grease to the oil seal lip.
Install a new gasket and the water pump with the 8 bolts.
Install 3 new O-rings to the timing chain cover as shown in the illustration.
Apply adhesive to the timing chain cover plug.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota genuine adhesive 1324, three bond 1324 or equivalent

s2.ptxt: Using a 10 mm socket hexagon wrench, install the timing chain cover plug.
Apply seal packing in a continuous line as shown in the illustration.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota genuine seal packing block, three bond 1207B or equivalent

item.ptxt: Remove any oil from the contact surface.
Install the timing chain cover within 3 minutes and tighten the bolts within 15 minutes after applying seal packing.
Do not start the engine for at least 4 hours after the installation.

s2.ptxt: Align the oil pump's drive rotor spline and crankshaft as shown in the illustration. Install the spline and chain cover plate to the crankshaft.
Loosely install the timing chain cover with the 19 bolts and 2 nuts, but do not tighten the bolts and nuts yet.
Excluding the bolts labeled A and C, tighten the bolts and nuts in this order: Area 1, Area 2 and Area 3.
Excluding the bolts labeled A, E and F, tighten the bolts and nuts in this order: Area 1, Area 3, Area 2.

torque.subtitle: for bolt C
for bolt B, D and nut

s2.ptxt: Tighten the bolts labeled A in this order: Area 2 and Area 3.
Tighten the bolt labeled F.
Tighten the bolts labeled E in Area 4.
Using an E5 and E6 "TORX" socket wrench, install the stud bolts.
Install a new tight plug.

s3.ptxt: Apply adhesive around a new tight plug.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Adhesive 1324, Three Bond 1324 or Equivalent

s3.ptxt: Using SST, install the tight plug as shown in the illustration.

s2.ptxt: Apply seal packing in a continuous line to the places shown in the illustration.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Seal Packing Black, Three Bond 1207B or Equivalent

item.ptxt: Remove any oil from the contact surface.
Install the crankcase within 3 minutes after applying seal packing.
Do not start the engine for at least 4 hours after the installation.

s2.ptxt: Temporarily install the oil pan with the 16 bolts and 2 nuts.
Uniformly tighten the 16 bolts and 2 nuts in the sequence shown in the illustration.
Install a new gasket and the oil strainer sub-assembly with the 2 bolts and nut in the sequence shown in the illustration.
Apply seal packing in a continuous line as shown in the illustration.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota genuine seal packing block, three bond 1207B or equivalent

item.ptxt: Remove any oil from the contact surface.
Install the oil pan within 3 minutes after applying seal packing.
Do not start the engine for at least 4 hours after the installation.

s2.ptxt: Temporarily install the oil pan with the 20 bolts and 2 nuts.
Uniformly tighten the 20 bolts and 2 nuts in the order shown in the illustration.
Install a new gasket and the drain plug.
Check that the crankshaft pulley matches the pulley labeled A in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: If the crankshaft pulley matches the pulley labeled B, replace the crankshaft pulley.

s2.ptxt: Align the pulley set key with the key groove of the pulley, and slide on the pulley.
Using SST, install a new pulley bolt.

atten3.ptxt: Do not reuse the pulley bolt.

s2.ptxt: Install the 2 gaskets to the head cover.
Apply seal packing to the places shown in the illustration.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Seal Packing Black, Three Bond 1207B or Equivalent

item.ptxt: Remove any oil from the contact surface.
Install the crankcase within 3 minutes after applying seal packing.
Do not start the engine for at least 2 hours after the installation.

s2.ptxt: Temporarily install the cover with the 19 bolts and 2 nuts.
Uniformly tighten the 19 bolts and 2 nuts in the sequence shown in the illustration.
In numerical order, confirm that the bolts labeled 1 to 8 are tightened to the torque specification. Tighten the bolts as necessary.
